thread.title: Dalit children's death: LJP chief says Haryana government accountable | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Dalit children's death: LJP chief says Haryana government accountable | Deccan Chronicle

author: PTI
title: Dalit children's death: LJP chief says Haryana government accountable | Deccan Chronicle
text:
PTI | October 21, 2015, 16.44 pm Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan. (Photo: PTI) Patna : BJP ally and Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan on Wednesday sought to fix the responsibility on the Haryana government for the death of two children of a Dalit family who were burnt alive in Sonped village of the state.
"Law and order is totally state government's accountability. Though the scheduled castes and scheduled tribes have constitutional protection, this issue is completely state government's responsibility," he said.
Two children died when their house on the outskirts of Delhi was set afire allegedly by a crowd of upper caste men in the wee hours on Tuesday. Vaibhav, who was two-and-a-half years old, and his sister, 11-month-old Divya, died on the spot after the attackersâ€™ allegedly poured petrol and set the house ablaze.
Their mother Rekha suffered 70 per cent burns and has been referred to Delhi for treatment while their father Jitender too suffered injuries while trying to save his family.
 Dalit deaths ablaze nation Ram Vilas Paswan Haryana Also Read Punjab will now get fulsome support from Centre: CM Parkash Singh Badal DMK Chief M.
